channel.title: The Mapping Problem on English
channel.description: Recent content in The Mapping Problem on English

item.title: Mapping Challenges
item.description:
Why Data Mapping Is Hard

Data mapping for entity resolution presents unique challenges that make it time-consuming and error-prone when done manually.

Challenge 1: Understanding Complex Specifications

Entity resolution systems like Senzing support dozens of feature types with hundreds of attributes:

  • NAME features: NAME_FIRST, NAME_LAST, NAME_MIDDLE, NAME_PREFIX, NAME_SUFFIX, NAME_ORG
  • ADDRESS features: ADDR_LINE1, ADDR_LINE2, ADDR_CITY, ADDR_STATE, ADDR_POSTAL_CODE, ADDR_COUNTRY
  • PHONE features: PHONE_NUMBER, PHONE_TYPE, PHONE_COUNTRY
  • Identifier features: SSN_NUMBER, DRIVERS_LICENSE_NUMBER, PASSPORT_NUMBER, NATIONAL_ID_NUMBER, etc.

The problem: You must understand which attributes are required vs optional, what formats are expected, and how they interact with the entity resolution engine.

item.title: Senzing Entity Model
item.description:
Understanding Senzing’s Data Format

Senzing uses a standardized JSON format for entity resolution. Each record represents either a PERSON or ORGANIZATION entity and contains structured information that Senzing uses to find matches and relationships.

Features vs Payload: The Key Distinction

The most important concept in Senzing mapping is the difference between Features and Payload:

Features (Used for Matching)

Features are attributes that Senzing uses to identify and match entities across records:

item.title: AI-Assisted Solution
item.description:
How AI Transforms the Mapping Process

Instead of spending days manually mapping data, you can use AI assistance to complete the work in under an hour - with better results and complete documentation.

The Senzing Mapping Assistant

This workshop teaches a structured, repeatable workflow called the Senzing Mapping Assistant. Rather than just asking AI to “write me a mapper,” you follow a 5-stage process that ensures correct, validated mappings every time.

item.title: Workshop Datasets
item.description:
Two Datasets, Same Workflow

This workshop includes two datasets that demonstrate the Senzing Mapping Assistant workflow at different complexity levels. Both follow the same 7-step process you learned in the previous sections.

Dataset 1: Customer Data (Exercise 1)

File: workshop/workspace/customers/customers.csv

Format: CSV with 120 records

Challenge Level: ⭐⭐ Intermediate

What’s in This Dataset?

A realistic customer database export containing:

  • 114 PERSON records - Individual customers
  • 6 ORGANIZATION records - Business customers

This mimics real-world scenarios where a single data source contains multiple entity types.
